content.description: This little boulder problem is pretty fun and just scary enough to make it enticing. Scramble up the just-off-vertical face, grab the summit jugs, and gather the courage to as the guidebook describes: "to officially tick this problem, you must stand erect on the summit."
content.protection: It is best not to fall, unless you want to carry pads all the way up there.
content.location: A little ways to the right of where the main approach trail joins the cliff, look for the triangle-shaped rock sticking up.

content.description: Sangria is a golden colored route left of Bombay Sapphire. A link-up with Bombay Sapphire has also been done at 12b.
content.protection: 11 bolts to an anchor with Mussy hooks.
content.location: This is the second line of bolts on the far right side of the wall.

content.description: Currently this is the easiest climb at this wall and thus the designated warm-up.
content.location:
It is a few feet left of

Sangria

on the far right side of the wall.

content.description: Start below a right-angling overlap. A few approach moves lead to abruptly difficult climbing over the overlap, trending left to pockets through a bulge. Gain a slab, from which much more moderate climbing on nice rock finishes things off.
content.location:
It is left of

Cuervo Gold

.

content.description: Cuervo Gold has an incredible variety of movement including many different angles from steep to slab. It is easy to distinguish by a large slot through the roof.
content.location:
It is about 15-20 feet left of

Moscow Mule

.

content.description: Bombay Sapphire is a great, slightly overhanging, technical route with a variety of pinches, sidepulls, crimps, and underclings. The route has several difficult and/or tricky sequences with many decent rests. The hardest moves start less than halfway up the route, with the last tough sequence near the top. Fantastic climbing!
content.location: The furthest right start on the wall, this route splits, however, and after 3 bolts - PBR (13a) goes right, and Bombay Sapphire goes left.
